title: Harry Robotham
text:
Horace Osborne Robotham (12 June 1879 – 12 September 1916) was an English professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="right%20half">right half</a> who played in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a> for <a href="Glossop%20North%20End%20A.F.C.">Glossop</a> and <a href="Wolverhampton%20Wanderers%20F.C.">Wolverhampton Wanderers</a>. He also played in the <a href="Southern%20Football%20League">Southern League</a> for <a href="Fulham%20F.C.">Fulham</a>, <a href="Gillingham%20F.C.">New Brompton</a> and <a href="Brentford%20F.C.">Brentford</a>.
Personal life.
On 26 November 1915, in <a href="Wolverhampton">Wolverhampton</a> during the <a href="First%20World%20War">First World War</a>, Robotham enlisted in the <a href="23rd%20%28Service%29%20Battalion%2C%20Middlesex%20Regiment%20%282nd%20Football%29">23rd (Service) Battalion</a> of the <a href="Middlesex%20Regiment">Middlesex Regiment</a>. He served his initial time on the <a href="Western%20Front%20%28World%20War%20I%29">Western Front</a> between <a href="Hazebrouck">Hazebrouck</a> and <a href="Bailleul%2C%20Nord">Bailleul</a> in 1916 and later took part in the <a href="Battle%20of%20the%20Somme">Battle of the Somme</a>. Robotham was killed on 12 September 1916 during the <a href="Battle%20of%20Flers%E2%80%93Courcelette">Battle of Flers-Courcelette</a>. His body was never recovered and his name is recorded on the <a href="Thiepval%20Memorial%20to%20the%20Missing%20of%20the%20Somme">Thiepval Memorial to the Missing of the Somme</a>.
